result.execSummary:
All charges against Lindsay Amber Schmidt in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lindsay Amber Schmidt is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lindsay Amber Schmidt

records.addlTxt:
2:50 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Lindsay Amber Schmidt, Defendant Lindsay Amber Schmidt in court, in custody. INCLUDES 21CM646, 22CM17, 22CM382 and 22CF16. ADA Smestad recites agreement. DE sworn. 22CF16 (WOPH): Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. PLEAS: DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Retail Theft in 22CF16. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Information forthcoming. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Retail Theft in 22CF16. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses and reads in 22CM17 for purposes of restitution and cases 21CM646 and 22CM382 outright. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. QUASH WARRANTS. Atty. Davis states DE is unable to pay attorney fees. Atty. Davis waives attorney fees from Order signed 4/19/22. 

Court orders: 
22CF16
S/W 2 years probation with conditions - consecutive to E/S in Dunn County case 19CF138
- No contact with Beth's Jewelry Shop in New Richmond, WI
- Restitution $668.37, payable to Beth's Jewelry Shop in New Richmond, WI; payable through DOC
- Restitution $292.21, payable to Carquest Auto Parts in River Falls, WI; payable through DOC
- Court Costs $268; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through DOC

Counsel to file letter regarding jail credit within one week. 
Adjourned: 3:34 PM. kma

9:22 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: S. Fox, ADA: M. Becker, Def Atty: Nicholas Von Davis, Def in custody - did not appear. OFF RECORD for scheduling. Includes 22CM382, 21CM646, 22CF16 and 22CM17. Court reschedules pleas. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Lindsay Amber Schmidt, Defendant Lindsay Amber Schmidt not in court.  INCLUDES 22CM382 (Set for INIT & PLEAS), Set for PLEAS: 21CM646, 22CF16 and 22CM17. Court reviews case, DE is in custody in Dunn County and unable to connect with courtroom today. Court resets PLEAS. State to prepare Order for Transport. Adjourned: 10:47 AM. kma
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
to appear by zoom for PLEAS scheduled for 8/25/22, filed by Atty Davis. Includes 21CM646, 22CM17, 22CF16, & 22CM382.      8/24/22: SRN approved. sf

Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Lindsay Amber Schmidt, Defendant Lindsay Amber Schmidt appeared by phone, in custody from Dunn County Jail. INCLUDES 22CM382 (Set for INIT), 21CM646, 22CF016 and 22CM017. Set for PLEAS. Court reviews files, notes 22CM382 was summonsed for October. Atty. Davis requests plea/sentencing hearings on all cases. ADA Smestad states there was an offer that did not include new file, will review offer. Court prefers to have DE in person for PLEAS. ADA Smestad will draft Order for Transport. Court sets PLEAS.
